item.title: 根据发表在《英国医学杂志》上的一项新研究，COVID-19 疫苗可将感染 COVID 后发生心力衰竭的风险降低 55%，血栓的风险降低 78%。
item.description:
COVID-19 vaccines were found to cut the risk of heart failure by up to 55% and blood clots by up to 78% following COVID infection, according to a new study published in the British Medical Journal. https://t.co/tbJ0UopzIo pic.twitter.com/e2JKqBAJfx

— ABC News (@ABC) March 19, 2024

item.title: 据研究人员称，美国石油和天然气生产排放的甲烷比以前想象的要多，每年造成的环境损害高达数十亿美元。
item.description:
The U.S. is emitting more methane from oil and gas production than previously thought — and it's causing billions of dollars in environmental damage per year, according to researchers. https://t.co/ftJEqBBi0L

— ABC News (@ABC) March 19, 2024

item.description:

item.description:

item.description:

item.title: 在反对禁用 TikTok 的理由中，一些批评者指出，据称该应用在中国的版本比较温和，这表明母公司字节跳动在美国推出了一款更强大的产品，以吸引消费者并吸走他们的数据。
item.description:
In making their case against a TikTok ban, some critics point to an allegedly tamer version of the app in China, suggesting that parent company ByteDance unleashed a more potent product in the U.S. to hook consumers and vacuum up their data. https://t.co/mE7wYTGzzR

— ABC News (@ABC) March 19, 2024

item.title: 哥斯拉在东京街头肆意践踏，令围观者惊心动魄，因为这只怪兽参加了一项旨在促进交通安全的活动。
item.description:
Godzilla stomped through the streets of Tokyo, thrilling onlookers as the monster took part in an event to promote traffic safety.

Better known for laying waste to the Japanese capital, a person in a Godzilla costume was appointed honorary police chief for a day. pic.twitter.com/EtMO2eNrOb

— ABC News (@ABC) March 19, 2024
